gui

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.Main

  • public class Main
extends java.lang.Object
    Main program class. Implements main GUI window and runs all the sub-programs
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $
    Author:
    Helion

      • setCardIcon

        public static void setCardIcon(javax.swing.JLabel card,
                               java.lang.String cardName,
                               java.lang.String state)
        Changes the image of the given card based on its state.
        States can be any of the following:
        - default: The sub program is not running and the mouse is not above the card
        - hovered: The sub program is not running and the mouse is hovering above the card
        - selected: The sub program is running and the mouse is not hovering above the card
        - quit: The sub program is running and the mouse is hovering above the card
        Parameters:
        card - JLabel card to modify the image of
        cardName - Name if the card's file, not including the state
        state - State of the card to be changed to

      • setCardInteractions

        private void setCardInteractions()
        Defines and implements the card interactions for the Main GUI

      • setClosing

        public static void setClosing(boolean status)
        Sets a flag that is used to determine if there is a sub program currently closing.
        This is used to make sure that Input.waitForInput() is exited in case a sub program is trying to exit while also waiting for input.
        Parameters:
        status - Status of the flag

      • setCurrentlyRunning

        public static void setCurrentlyRunning(java.lang.String string)
        Sets the currently running sub program. Use "none" if there is no more sub program running.
        Parameters:
        string - Sub program name

      • setInteractions

        private void setInteractions()
        Defines and implements the basic interactions for the Main GUI

        Parameters:

        Parameters:
